H0.text: Time is what a light-year measures.

H1.text: Mass is what a light-year measures.

H2.text: Distance is what a lightâ€‘year measures.

H3.text: Brightness is what a light-year measures.

A4.text: A light-year is a unit of length used to express astronomical distances.

A5.text: As defined by the International Astronomical Union (IAU), a light-year is the distance that light travels in vacuum in one Julian year (365.25 days).
